# YugabyteDB stable documentation — llms.txt

This file describes the YugabyteDB **stable** documentation set for LLM and tooling consumption. Stable corresponds to the current LTS release (see versioning below).

## Project

- **Name:** YugabyteDB Docs
- **Product:** YugabyteDB — distributed SQL database (PostgreSQL-compatible YSQL, Cassandra-compatible YCQL, Redis-compatible YEDIS).
- **Live site:** https://docs.yugabyte.com
- **Stable base path (URL):** https://docs.yugabyte.com/stable/
- **Content root (repo):** `yugabyte-db/docs/content/stable/` (this directory’s sibling files).

## Versioning

- **Stable** is an alias for the current LTS series (e.g. v2025.2). Exact version and build are in `yugabyte-db/docs/data/currentVersions.json` under `dbVersions` (entry with `"alias":"stable"`).
- Other doc series (v2025.1, v2024.2, v2024.1, v2.20, etc.) live under `docs/content/<series>/` and may differ from stable; when answering for “current” or “latest” behavior, prefer stable.

## Tech stack

- **Generator:** Hugo (config under `docs/config/`).
- **Content format:** Markdown with YAML front matter; shortcodes (e.g. `{{< shortcode >}}`).
- **Build/deploy:** Netlify; redirects and deploy config in `docs/netlify.toml`.

## Top-level structure of stable docs

All paths below are relative to `yugabyte-db/docs/content/stable/`. Section names correspond to URL segments and menu areas.

| Path | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `quick-start-yugabytedb-managed/` | Quick start for YugabyteDB Managed (Aeon) |
| `architecture/` | DB architecture: query layer, DocDB, sharding, replication, transactions |
| `deploy/` | Deploying YugabyteDB: manual, multi-DC, public clouds, Kubernetes |
| `launch-and-manage/` | Running clusters: monitor, alert, query tuning |
| `explore/` | Feature-focused guides: YSQL, YCQL, transactions, observability, multi-region, fault tolerance |
| `develop/` | Application development: drivers/ORMs, data modeling, tutorials, multi-cloud, AI, best practices |
| `integrations/` | Integrations: CDC, Spark, Hasura, Spring, tools |
| `additional-features/` | Connection Manager (YSQL), PG extensions, change data capture |
| `manage/` | Backup/restore, data migration |
| `secure/` | Authentication, authorization, TLS, audit logging |
| `troubleshoot/` | Cluster and node troubleshooting |
| `yugabyte-platform/` | **YugabyteDB Anywhere (YBA):** install, prepare, configure, create/manage universes, backup/restore, upgrade, security, alerts, admin |
| `yugabyte-cloud/` | **YugabyteDB Aeon (managed):** basics, clusters, connect, security, monitor, admin, quickstart |
| `yugabyte-voyager/` | Migration tool: migrate, reference, known issues |
| `yedis/` | Redis-compatible API: quick start, develop, API |
| `api/` | Reference: YSQL (SQL language, datatypes, expressions, UDFs, etc.), YCQL |
| `reference/` | Configuration reference (e.g. yb-master, yb-tserver), default ports |
| `releases/` | Release policy; **ybdb-releases/** (YugabyteDB), **yba-releases/** (YugabyteDB Anywhere), tech advisories |
| `benchmark/` | TPC-C, scalability, resilience |
| `faq/` | FAQ and comparisons |
| `sample-data/` | Sample datasets |
| `contribute/` | Contributing to docs and core database |
| `legal/` | Legal |
| `best-practices-operations/` | Operations best practices |

## Important paths for common tasks

- **Create/edit a universe (YBA):** `yugabyte-platform/create-deployments/`, `yugabyte-platform/manage-deployments/`
- **Upgrade YBA/DB:** `yugabyte-platform/upgrade/`, `prepare-to-upgrade.md` under upgrade
- **Releases and version numbers:** `releases/ybdb-releases/`, `releases/yba-releases/`; version data in `docs/data/currentVersions.json`
- **Runtime/configuration flags:** `reference/configuration/`; YBA runtime config: `yugabyte-platform/administer-yugabyte-platform/manage-runtime-config.md`
- **On-prem / manual install (YBA):** `yugabyte-platform/prepare/server-nodes-software/`, `yugabyte-platform/install-yugabyte-platform/`, `yugabyte-platform/configure-yugabyte-platform/`
- **Quick start (DB):** `deploy/manual-deployment/`; managed: `quick-start-yugabytedb-managed/` and `yugabyte-cloud/cloud-quickstart/`

## File and URL conventions

- **Index pages:** Sections use `_index.md` for landing pages; their `title` and `linkTitle` drive nav and headings.
- **URLs:** Stable doc URL = base `https://docs.yugabyte.com/stable/` + path from `content/stable/` with directory separators as slashes and `.md` stripped. Example: `content/stable/yugabyte-platform/create-deployments/create-universe-multi-zone.md` → `/stable/yugabyte-platform/create-deployments/create-universe-multi-zone/`
- **Front matter:** `title`, `description`, `menu`, `aliases` are common. `cascade.unversioned: true` used for sections that don’t vary by version (e.g. some release pages).
- **Shortcodes:** Used for UI chunks (e.g. `{{< sections/3-boxes >}}`, `{{< page-finder/head >}}`). Prefer the surrounding Markdown and headings for semantic understanding.

## Release stubs and version updates

When adding or updating a **release stub** (new release entry) for YugabyteDB or YugabyteDB Anywhere, follow the workspace rule in `.cursor/rules/release-stub.mdc`: update the relevant series file under `releases/ybdb-releases/` or `releases/yba-releases/` and the matching entry in `docs/data/currentVersions.json` (version, versionShort, appVersion). Do not invent changelog sections; leave Improvements/Bug fixes for the user to add.

## Repo context (outside stable docs)

- **DB and YBA code:** `yugabyte-db/src/`, `yugabyte-db/managed/` (see repo root `AGENTS.md`).
- **Docs tooling and config:** `yugabyte-db/docs/config/`, `yugabyte-db/docs/contributing/`, `yugabyte-db/docs/README.md`.

## Summary for LLMs

- Prefer **stable** (`content/stable/`) for “current” or “latest” documentation.
- Use **currentVersions.json** for exact version and build strings.
- **YugabyteDB Anywhere** = YBA = self-managed DBaaS (yugabyte-platform); **YugabyteDB Aeon** = managed cloud (yugabyte-cloud).
- For “how do I do X in the UI” or “how do I create/upgrade a universe,” start from `yugabyte-platform/` and the paths listed above.
